intro: Deiregyne durangensis, commonly known as the Durango thistle, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand dry conditions. Its leaves are often spiny, providing a defense mechanism against herbivores. Deiregyne durangensis plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
